title: Is it only me who feels that the boards are far more different from last year?
body:
I mean, do you all remember the days;
When Lord Sesshomaru absolutely, soul crushingly hated assassins
When Talon12 was the crazy Yasuo man
When HeartVine and Roguestoney refused to let the number game die
When Fitzky was not shunned by the boards
When JasonWazzza was around
When LGC Elam left a long essay response on a post
When StealthVortex88 was a whiny bitch (wait a sec...)

Don't you all miss the good old days?

Don't tell me I'm going crazy because I think the OCE boards is slowly dying out

replies.body:
**Fucking Yasuo, NERF FIZZ!! Piece of shit champ Zed, 
LEE NEEDS TO BE REMOVED. Twitch is op...  FUCK!** 


{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}} 

To be fair...
I have nothing against assassins, I just dislike the lack of counterplay.
The two just happen to coincide more often than not...
You have not being paying attention if you think Lord Sess doesn't still bitch about assassins. By this stage I'm pretty sure he has nightmares about Lee Sin
The night terrors return in strength every time I shut my eyes.....
The forums were more active than boards and I preferred it over the new boards. On that note, does anybody remember Molendo? His road to Gold?? Good times...
Everyone that knows anything remembers golendo.

OCE used to have a pretty active forum life despite the tiny population (in comparison to other servers) when we still had the forum. Many rage-quitted forum lives after the migration to Boards, some moved on and quitted League entirely, and so on so forth. And so the Board has been slowly dragged into what is commonly referred to as the "death spiral" with less and less people really come to stick around (I'm also guilty of this, I often get fix for my forum addiction on NA board nowadays....), until it becomes what it is like now, which is a bit cold around here. It's more like a Q&A section rather than a discussion forum now, unfortunately.

But hey. It's still alive.

I kinda wish there could be an influx of players using Board, or even old crews returning, and get it going like we always do. Then again, times carry on and change like nobody's business, we can only look back before we move on.

Personally I kinda prefer the small OCE boards to the NA ones.

In NA, your voice is just lost, you're a small dot among millions, and unless you have 400 upvotes next to your name, whatever you have to say is meaningless. Meanwhile on OCE, if you see a post with more than 3 upvotes, you know it'll be life-chanigng.

Also on OCE it feels like a neighbourhood where everyone knows each other, theres Glenys down the road who always makes way too much lemon curd, Little Billy who's ball keeps coming over the fence, and William who mows his lawns at 5:00am every Saturday. 

Meanwhile NA is like a Tokyo apartment block, if you talk to someone one day, and it's pretty much guaranteed you'll never see them again in your life even though they live 3 doors down. 

I suppose it's personal though.

I think he's trying to say the other people on boards are shunning you, not you are shunning boards. You always had pretty polarising opinions so I don't think that's changed much, some people wholeheartedly agree with you and others disagree and all at varying times, I wouldn't say you're being shunned.

Yeah I mean I like to use a range of vocabulary from time to time but "shunned" I haven't really heard too often. Also I try not to pose myself as a "troll" or a "toxic" member of the boards but rather an "anomaly". Someone who provides a different opinion to others and maybe a different perspective of things, like I explained about Sesshomaru "balancing the scales" as he tends to disagree with Riot on a number of occasions where others tend to always agree and "accept". I think it's much healthier for the boards when there's more then one perspective on things because it allows others to "think outside their own opinion" and maybe even reconsider what they originally thought. I'm being really broad here but you get the general idea. 

The boards is like a small community and I believe arguments/conflict is what helps establish better ideas and ultimately better decisions.
Don't worry, we love you Fitzky! ^^
